  In FY2 017, we committed to the Science Based Targets Initiative (SBTI) , and to setting a Science Ba sed 
Target for our emissions reduction goal  in the near future. Science Based Targets is a methodology designed 
to set GHG reduction targets that align with climate science in order to mitigate the rise in global temperature s 
to less than two degrees Celsius compared to pre -industrial temperatures.  
 
To view Seagate’s Environment, Health, Safety and S ustaina bility Policy, see page 63. 
 
Energy  
 
Total internal electricity consumption decreased slightly 
to 1.633 million megawatt hours (MWh) , from 1.636 
million MWh in FY2016 , largely due to the expansion of 
our manufacturing facility in Korat, Thailand.  We shipped 
30 more EBs in FY2017 than FY2016 , which is five times 
the growth seen from FY2015 to FY2016. This resulted in 
a total of 6,220 MWh per EB of storage capacity shipp ed, 
down from 7,018 MWh per EB shipped in FY2016, 
accounting  for an 11 percent reduction year -over-year 
(YoY)  for MWh of electricity consumed internally per EB  
of storage capacity  shipped.  
 
Higher -capacity drives require increased energy to 
manufacture, and normalizing our energy consumption 
per storage capacity shipped demonstrates our progress  
toward  energy efficiency per EB of storage capacity 
manufactured and shipped.  
  
Seagate also continue s to focus efforts on energy 
conservation throughout our operations. In FY2017  we 
saved 28,200 MWh of electricity from multiple energy 
conservation proje cts, meeting our conservation goal of 
over 24,000 MWh . Energy savings are calculated using 
the Metered B aseline Met hod (MBM ); since FY2014, the 
site-initiated energy conservation p rojects have saved a 
cumulative 127,000 MWh.   
 
At our design centers in Fremont, California and 
Singapore we generated a total of 2,200 MWh of 
renewable energy over the last half of FY2016 and 
throughout all  of FY2017.  Our manufacturing sites in 
Wuxi , China  and Londonderry, Northern Ireland  are 
certified to ISO 50001  Energy Manage ment System.
